content: Children, Youth and Their Families | San Francisco Skip to main content English Español 中文 Filipino Children, Youth and Their Families We fund programs for San Francisco's young people and their families. Our 2024-29 funding cycle We announced funding awards for the 2024-2029 Request for Proposals (RFP) on March 11, 2024. See 2024-2029 RFP award decisions Grantee resources Guides, orientation materials, and other information for programs we fund. Services we fund We fund 6 types of services for young people. Trainings for youth service workers We help workers in City funded youth programs build their skills. See more about workshops and trainings. Meetings Upcoming meetings Free City College Oversight Committee meeting Friday, Nov 1, 2024, 10:00 am Children, Youth and Their Families' Oversight and Advisory Committee meeting Monday, Nov 18, 2024, 5:00 pm See more meetings Past meetings Children, Youth and Their Families' Oversight and Advisory Committee meeting Monday, Sep 23, 2024, 5:00 pm Free City College Oversight Committee meeting Friday, Aug 30, 2024, 10:00 am Cancelled Children, Youth and Their Families' Oversight and Advisory Committee meeting Monday, Aug 12, 2024, 5:00 pm See past meetings Student Success Fund The Student Success Fund (SSF) gives grants to SFUSD schools to help with academic success and student well-being. Learn more about the SSF News Mayor London Breed, State Superintendent Tony Thurmond and Local Leaders on the Board of Education's Intent to Appoint Dr. Maria Su Superintendent of San Francisco Unified School District October 18, 2024 Mayor London Breed Announces School Stabilization Team to Provide Support for San Francisco Public Schools September 22, 2024 Mayor Breed and the Department of Children, Youth & Families Announce New Grant Funding to Support Young People and Families April 15, 2024 See more news Events There are no upcoming events right now. View past events Resources What we do DCYF funded services We fund 6 types of services for young people. DCYF initiatives Citywide initiatives DCYF leads together with our partners. DCYF Grantmaking Cycle Our 3 part, 5 year process for deciding which youth programs to fund DCYF nutrition program Free meals for young people Support for DCYF funded programs DCYF grantee resources Guides, orientation materials, and other information for programs funded by DCYF Trainings for youth service workers We provide professional development to workers in City funded youth programs. Youth service jobs Find jobs with DCYF funded youth programs About DCYF funds programs serving young people up to age 24 and their families. We’re committed to advancing equity and healing trauma. We bring together and work alongside community-based organizations, government agencies, and schools. Together, we make San Francisco a great place to grow up. Learn more about us Subcommittees Children, Youth and Their Families' Oversight and Advisory Committee Free City College Oversight Committee Social media Facebook Instagram Twitter More ways to connect Subscribe or submit a request Contact Children, Youth and Their Families 1390 Market Street Suite 900 San Francisco, CA 94102 Get directions Phone General inquiries 628-652-7100 Email General inquiries info@dcyf.org Media inquiries emily.davis@dcyf.org Request public records Email sunshine@dcyf.org to submit a request.
